Joined Rep. @VellaWilkinson and Mayor @JosephJSolomon in Warwick yesterday. We had a great afternoon speaking with voters. Thanks to everyone who took the time to speak with us. https://t.co/2nhETc4XMI

Today is #NationalEarlyVoteDay ! Have you made your plan to vote?  Visit https://t.co/8sPjhYjV7Z to get details how early voting works in your state. #RhodeIsland voters don't forget you can also call the 211 Voter Information Hotline for info on how to vote. #BeAVoter https://t.co/qRzXr2SnWj
Thank you to Carpenters Local 330 for their endorsement. I am proud to have their support in this election! #TeamReed #JackReed #ReedForRI https://t.co/63uUA5SamE
My op-ed in today's @projo: https://t.co/t1JiEAEDxr
Thanks to @NewtownAction for all of their hard work and for their endorsement. I'm proud to work alongside Newtown Action Alliance to promote gun safety. https://t.co/YjbEVyQK4U

Tonight at 6:00PM I will be co-hosting a virtual phone bank in support of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris. You can sign up for this event through the link below! I hope to see you there. #TeamReed #ReedForRI #Election2020 #BeAVoter https://t.co/wBwFGXT0gx
I'm co-hosting a virtual phone bank in support of @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris on Monday October 19th.  More details are included in the link. Sign up today! https://t.co/wBwFGXT0gx

Make a plan to vote! If you plan on voting by mail the deadline to return your mail-in ballot application is today at 4:00 PM. RI's early voting period begins tomorrow. Learn more about your options for voting through this link! #Election2020  https://t.co/Uu123AwGnE
Thank you @LCVoters! As a Senator from the Ocean State I am committed to this fight -- one that will lead us to a healthier more equitable and sustainable future. https://t.co/kt7iof82bj
Join us tomorrow evening! https://t.co/VOD7xXHZCU

What better way to wrap up a visit to Cranston than with a stop at the Cranston Greek Festival? This year is different but thanks to the hard work of dedicated volunteers Rhode Island's Greek American community is making sure that this annual tradition can safely continue. #Opa https://t.co/PA0VE7z9Yn
Had a great time knocking doors with @SenatorMillerRI and @mbuccicranston in my home town of Cranston today. https://t.co/FvgaywIaFy
Spent the afternoon having some great conversations with voters in the Pawtuxet Valley. https://t.co/6ymYRXYCyp
Tonight I think there is one thing we can all agree upon: we have to get out and #VOTE   https://t.co/8sPjhYjV7Z
Had a great time this weekend stopping by an event hosted by the Barrington Democrats. Thanks to everyone who came by to show your support! https://t.co/QJ0IqaEjMU

NEWS: I've joined @EdMarkey and 35 of our colleagues to push @Debates to include climate change in the upcoming presidential debates.  Voters deserve to know how their candidates plan to tackle the climate crisis if elected. #AskAboutClimate https://t.co/KCn1bgtwr9

Did you know that today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay?  Head over to https://t.co/Gq1UEDBsjy to register to vote or check your registration. In Rhode Island the deadline to register to vote is October 4th! #BeAVoter
Wishing all who celebrate a blessed Rosh Hashanah. Shanah Tovah!

Celebrating #HispanicHeritageMonth which begins today. Hispanic and Latinx communities across the United States have enriched the fabric of our nation.  Learn more about the history and contributions of Latinos in #RhodeIsland at: https://t.co/EBCXfu3818

For years I have been fighting to do what’s right and pass stronger gun laws to make our communities safer. That’s why I’m proud to receive the endorsement of @giffordscourage.  Together we can #EndGunViolence https://t.co/02rZTHuVFm

Today marks the 19th anniversary of #September11. We pause on this day to solemnly remember to commemorate the lives that were lost and to honor the heroes who sacrificed everything in order to provide safety and comfort to those in danger. #NeverForget

Wishing you a happy #LaborDay2020. Celebrate safely. In 2020 we acknowledge and give special thanks to those on the frontlines during this pandemic.  But thanks are not enough. I will continue my fight in DC to ensure that workers have adequate access to PPE & hazard pay.

In 1963 a young John Lewis addressed the crowds at the original #MarchOnWashington. His spirit lives on. We must continue his fight to protect voting rights and to address the systemic issues of racial injustice in our country.

These youth inspire us to be better and do more. On issues ranging from climate change to common sense gun reform to racial justice young people are making a difference to create a more just and equitable society.

Today is the 57th anniversary of the #MarchOnWashington. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s granddaughter Yolanda Renee King spoke and said it will be her generation that will fulfill her grandfather’s dream of true equality.

I voted! Did you know that you can vote early in person for the September State Primary? Rhode Island voters visit https://t.co/5ttCPtsX4E  for more information on how you can vote this year. #vote https://t.co/Sw525pu7UH
@BridgetEileenRI @Jorge_Elorza @SamuelWBell @JohnJLombardiRI @SamanthaWeiser1 Thank you for your support!
So proud of my friend @JoeBiden. What a speech! Time to make hope and history rhyme and elect Joe Biden as our next president.

Addressed the Northeast Region event today at the #DemConvention. Thanks to everyone who participated--and great to see so many from #RhodeIsland. We are all in for @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris! #BidenHarris https://t.co/ItvMlOUCAo

Heading back to DC today. We are fighting for a comprehensive COVID relief package that puts the health safety and needs of Americans first. And that includes an extension of expanded UI benefits as well as provisions that support workers and small businesses. https://t.co/c6FD3McQTC

Step two: download your mail ballot application. The deadlines to submit your applications are August 18 (primaries)  and October 13 (General Election). Check out the RI elections calendar and download your applications here: https://t.co/HOOrFE10xK  #Vote

Election Day is set it law. It will be November 3rd. President Trump can't change it & should read the Constitution.  Step one is--if you haven't already done so--register to vote. The deadline for the RI primaries is August 9th. Find out more here: https://t.co/XDSvvf9vQg
Less than a hundred days until Election Day.  Thanks to the Warwick Democratic City Committee for their kind endorsement. https://t.co/6lUtIxcFAb
